text: I am working on a project where I need to cluster similar images of street art. How can I get the relevant feature vectors from these images for clustering?\n
We want to develop a simple application where users can take a photo of any object and find the description of it. Help us with creating a model that extracts features from the object's image.\n
I have a set of food images and I want to create a model that differentiates between different types of cuisine.\n
Show me the right API call to generate image feature vectors using MobileNet V2 architecture so that I can perform a classification task.\n
My dog is always getting into things that can be dangerous. Can you help me identify the object my dog is about to eat?\n
A photo is sent to me, and I would like to know what objects are in the photo.\n
Analyze customer reviews and identify positive and negative sentiments, so please convert the text reviews into vectors.\n
Recommend a method to extract image feature vectors with MobileNetV2. \n
Write an example code to use a pre-trained model to convert a sentence \"My cat is sitting on the porch\" into high-dimensional vectors.\n###Input: My cat is sitting on the porch\n
Analyze a collection of images of pets to obtain meaningful features and club them into categories based on their appearance and other characteristics.\n
We are building a model for car brand recognition. Before training, we need to extract features from car images.\n

I have a customer service chatbot, and I would like to analyze the similarity between customer queries using NLP.\n
I have hundreds of images and I want to group them in categories, but first I need to extract features from those images.\n
Analyze the given image dataset containing healthy and unhealthy plants by extracting features using pre-trained MobileNetV2 model.\n

Can you tell me the type of food in this image?\n

Analyze large data sets containing various customer reviews. Transform the text from these reviews into vectors for further analysis like sentiment, similar phrases, and other natural language processing tasks.\n
